definition: land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: On the grounds of the Deer Garden Temple sits the Golden Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 金阁寺座落在鹿苑寺的庭园里。
这大厦四周的庭园广阔。

sentences.english: Though his voice may shatter your dreams as the north wind lays waste the garden.
sentences.chinese: 即便她的声音或会震碎你的梦幻，如北风吹荒庭园。

sentences.english: He slipped underneath the gate, and was safe at last in the wood outside the garden.
sentences.chinese: 它从栅栏门下熘逃，终于平安置身于庭园外的树林里。

sentences.english: It was a good spot for fault-finding.
sentences.chinese: 这是个给庭园找缺陷的好地方。

sentences.english: Can cultivate at curtilage or wayside.
sentences.chinese: 可以种植于庭园或路旁。

sentences.english: He said that cleaning garden not only requires cleaness, but also beauty and naturalness.
sentences.chinese: 茶师说，打扫庭园不只是要求清洁，也要求美和自然。

sentences.english: The tree, which had grown too large, dominated the little garden.
sentences.chinese: 这棵树长得太大了，独占了这小庭园。

sentences.english: He started a landscape company, buying his equipment on credit.
sentences.chinese: 他开办了一家庭园设计公司，贷款买的设备。

sentences.english: The chirps of the small garden birds sounded distant.
sentences.chinese: 远处传来庭园小鸟的鸣啭。

definition: winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
